pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:2.12.1: It is hard to make out from the Pali what the announcement is about. The crucial word appaṭisaṁviditaṁ can be read as an adjective qualifying khādanīyaṁ and bhojanīyaṁ, in which case it is the food that needs to be announced. Alternatively, it can be regarded as an independent sentence verb, in which case it would seem that it is the risky and dangerous nature of the dwellings that needs to be announced. The word commentary in part supports the former interpretation, whereas the origin story supports the latter. Given this uncertainty, I have opted to translate according to what seems to make the best sense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.2: That is, 500 bow-lengths. [See essay on Measures.]
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:3.1.14: Sp.2.573: Pañcannaṃ paṭisaṃviditanti pañcasu sahadhammikesu, “Pañcannaṁ paṭisaṃviditaṁ means the five co-monastics.” That is, a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun.
